Osceola Youth Center
3030 Long Lane Rd,
Evart, MI, 49639
Re: License #: CI670414130
Investigation #: 2024C0000939SI
Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
2

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/15/23, there was an altercation at the facility. Youth
assaulted a staff member and the staff member responded with
physical assault rather than appropriate restraint techniques. The
staff continued to attempt to attack the youth.
Investigation The Complainant is the assigned facility Consultant and was
interviewed via Teams November 20, 2023. Consultant
reported during review of an incident report it was documented
Staff 1 was upset and continuously attempting to run up on Youth
A and had to be held back by another staff member. Consultant
stated she was not aware of the incident until reading the incident
report. Consultant stated she went to the facility unannounced on
November 20, 2023, and all administration staff were off site.
Consultant reported she called Director via telephone and
provided him the details of the allegation. Consultant stated
Director told her he watched the video, reported Staff 1 was still
working but she had called in for the last several shifts.
Consultant reported she requested Director develop an agency
response plan and email her the plan.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director stated Staff 1 notified the facility she was quitting, and her
last day would be November 28, 2023, after her shift. Director
reported he watched the video and Staff 1 should never have
responded how she did toward Youth A. Director stated Staff 1 is
fully trained in de-escalation and redirection of youth. Director
reported Staff 1 never actually hit or made contact with Youth A
due to other staff stopping Staff 1 from reaching Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor described walking into the until and seeing Youth A
upset and yelling at Staff 3. Supervisor stated she heard Youth A
say, “what you looking at bitch” and dart toward Staff 1.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 stood up and said, “what you going to
do?” Supervisor described Youth A swinging on Staff 1 and
grabbing Staff 1’s hair. Supervisor reported along with Staff 3’s
help they attempted a finger peel to get Youth A to release Staff
1’s hair. Supervisor stated Youth A ripped out two of Staff 1’s
braids at the root. Supervisor reported Staff 1 was very upset and
was saying something but could not recall exactly what Staff 1
was saying. Supervisor stated she told Staff 1 and Staff 3 to get
the other youth off the unit while Supervisor and Staff 2 had Youth
A in a restraint. Supervisor described at the same time Staff 3
3

was having to physically use her body and hold Staff 1 back from
getting to Youth A. Supervisor reported Staff 1 continued to try
and reach Youth A, but Staff 3 was able to keep Staff 1 away from
Youth A and get Staff 1 to eventually leave the unit. Supervisor
denied seeing Staff 1 ever hit or make contact with Youth A.
Supervisor described the situation as being chaotic. Supervisor
reported Staff 1’s actions were completely inappropriate and not
how staff are trained to respond to youth at the facility. Supervisor
stated Staff 1 has not worked with the girls since the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
1 reported it was her last day working at the facility as she quit.
Staff 1 stated after the incident with Youth A she did not feel it was
a good job fit. Staff 1 described sitting in a chair across the room
when Youth A was getting upset and yelling at Staff 3. Staff 1
reported Supervisor entered the unit and attempted to de-escalate
Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A looked over at Staff 1 and said
something like, “why you looking at me” or “who are you looking
at.” Staff 1 reported Youth A then started running towards her so
Staff 1 stood up and Youth A started hitting her. Staff 1 described
using her arms to block Youth A’s hits when Youth A grabbed
Staff 1’s braids. Staff 1 stated she was using her hands to hold
her hair and was yelling for help. Staff 1 reported Supervisor and
Staff 2 attempted to finger peel Youth A’s hands from Staff 1’s
braids but Youth A was able to pull out a braid. Staff 1 stated
things became a blur, but she knows she was trying to get back to
Youth A. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 was stopping Staff 1 from
reaching Youth A. Staff 1 denied hitting or making any contact
with Youth A. Staff 1 was asked by the DHHS Worker what her
plan was if she did get to Youth A, Staff 1 responded she honestly
did not know but she was very angry and in pain from having her
braids ripped out. DHHS Worker asked Staff 1 again if she was
trying to hurt Youth A if she got to her, Staff 1 responded again
she did not know, but she was very angry and wanted to get to
her. Staff 1 stated she did not know what she would have done
had staff not stopped her. Staff 1 denied being in a situation like
this before and reported how she reacted to Youth A is not how
she was trained to respond to youth when they are escalated.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Nurse reported she saw Youth A after the incident and did not
observe any scratches, bruises, or marks. Nurse stated Youth A
was missing some hair and reported Youth A told her Youth D
pulled it out when Youth A and Youth D were fighting.
4

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth A stated she went after Staff 1 because she did not like the
way Staff 1 was looking at her. Youth A reported staff had to
restrain and stop Staff 1 from getting to her. Youth A stated she
was also restrained because she was going after Staff 1 and
Youth D. Youth A could not recall if Staff 1 was saying anything to
her during the incident. Youth A stated she did not know for sure
if Staff 1 hit her during the incident. Youth A denied seeing Staff 1
since the event.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth B reported Staff 1 went after Youth A for some reason, so
Youth B screamed, and a staff member stopped Staff 1. Youth B
stated Staff 1 was “pissed off” because Youth A pulled Staff 1’s
hair. Youth B denied seeing Staff 1 act like that any other time.
Youth B stated she did not see Staff 1 hit Youth A at all during the
incident.
DHHS Worker and I asked to speak to Youth C, Youth C
refused to come and speak with us.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
2 described Youth A being upset and Supervisor trying to
deescalate Youth A. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 was sitting in a chair
across the room, not involved in the conversation, when Youth A
turned toward Staff 1 and said, “what you looking at.” Staff 2
reported Staff 1 stood up and said, “what’s up then” and Youth A
ran toward Staff 1 and started hitting Staff 1 and pulling Staff 1’s
hair. Staff 2 stated Youth A was able to pull out a lock of Staff 1’s
hair. Staff 2 described her and Supervisor doing a finger peel to
get Youth A to release Staff 1’s hair. Staff 2 stated Supervisor
and Staff 2 put Youth A in a two-person standing restraint but
were struggling because Youth A was still very escalated and
trying to get Staff 1. Staff 2 reported after separating Youth A and
Staff 1, Staff 1 came after Youth A. Staff 2 described Staff 3
holding Staff 1 back and keeping Staff 1 away from Youth A. Staff
2 stated Staff 3 got Staff 1 off the unit to deescalate her, but Staff
2 was pretty sure Staff 1 entered the unit again. Staff 2 denied
seeing Staff 1 hit or punch Youth A. Staff 2 reported she has
never seen Staff 1 act that way. Staff 2 stated staff are not trained
to respond like Staff 1 did to Youth A. Staff 2 denied seeing Staff
1 work on the girls’ unit since the incident with Youth A.
5

Youth D was interviewed face to face at a facility on
November 30, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth D reported she does not know what caused Youth A to
become upset and attack Staff 1. Youth D stated Staff 1 got upset
because Youth A pulled her hair out. Youth D described Staff 1
being held back by a staff member, walking away but then coming
back again trying to get at Youth A. Youth D denied Staff 1 ever
touching Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on December 6, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker and again on December 8,
2023. Staff 3 stated she does not recall who went after who first
between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 3 described Youth A asking
Staff 1 “what ya looking at” and Staff 1 saying something back.
Staff 3 reported she could not recall what Staff 1 said back to
Youth A. Staff 3 stated Youth A grabbed Staff 1’s braid so staff
worked on trying to get Youth A’s hands free from Staff 1’s hair.
Staff 3 stated Youth A and Staff 1 were separated but Staff 1 was
very upset. Staff 3 reported she had to physically push Staff 1
backwards to get Staff 1 away from Youth A. Staff 3 stated Staff 1
got past her at one point, but Staff 3 was able to get back in front
of Staff 1 and prevent her from getting to Youth A. Staff 3
described Staff 1 as lunging in Youth A’s direction and yelling.
Staff 3 could not recall what Staff 1 was yelling to Youth A. Staff 3
stated she was finally able to get Staff 1 off the unit. Staff 3
denied seeing Staff 1 ever act that way. Staff 3 stated staff are
“absolutely not” trained to respond that way to youth. Staff 3
described another incident where she had to push Staff 4 out of
the boys’ unit because Staff 4 was engaging in a verbal agrument
with a youth. Staff 3 stated a youth was saying racist stuff to Staff
1 when Staff 4 “kinda got in the youth’s face” and told the youth he
was not going to talk to a female that way. Staff 3 reported Staff 4
and the youth were verbally arguing back and forth with Staff 4
getting closer and closer to the youth. Staff 3 stated she stepped
in between the youth and Staff 4 and pushed Staff 4 out the door
and closed the door behind them. Staff 3 could not recall who the
youth was but thought it was Youth E.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on December 11, 2023.
Staff 1 denied any event where Staff 4 was verbally arguing with a
youth and Staff 3 had to intervene. Staff 1 reported she could not
recall any time a youth was making racist comments to her while
working at the facility.
6

Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 12, 2023. Youth E described Staff 4 as being one of
his favorite staff members while he was at the facility. Youth E is
currently placed at a different facility. Youth E denied ever being
in a verbal argument with Staff 4 or Staff 4 make any inappropriate
comments to him.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 12, 2023. Youth F denied having any concerns with
Staff 4 and described Staff 4 as pretty “chill.” Youth F stated he
never saw Staff 4 get into Youth E’s face or see Staff 4 be
removed from the unit by another staff member.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 12, 2023. Staff 4 described an incident when a youth
was saying vulgar comments to a female staff. Staff 4 stated he
could not recall the female staff. Staff 4 stated he “lost my cool”
and Staff 3 had to put her arm on Staff 4 to keep space between
the youth and himself. Staff 4 reported just yelling at the youth
and telling the youth he was going to be a nobody if he continued
to talk like that to females. Staff 4 stated he “was basically calling
the youth out on his bullshit.” Staff 4 reported he wished he would
not have gotten so personal with the youth by targeting the youth’s
personal stuff when yelling at the youth. Staff 4 stated staff are
trained to “take it on the chin, not let it affect us.” Staff 4 reported
he was tired and had worked a long stretch without any days off.
An email exchanged occurred with Assistant Facility
Administrator, AFA and I on December 12, 2023. It was
determined Youth E, who I interviewed, was not the youth Staff 4
had engaged in with the verbal argument. Staff 3 only knew the
youth’s first name when describing the incident with Staff 4. Youth
E had the same first name as Youth G. Staff 4 argued with so
Staff 4 thought it was the same youth being questioned about
when I interviewed him.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of November 15, 2023, was reviewed November
28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. There is no sound
on the video footage. The video shows Staff 1 sitting in a chair,
then stand up as Youth A runs toward her and Youth A starts
punching Staff 1. Supervisor and Staff 2 run to assist as Youth A
is seen grabbing Staff 1’s braids. Supervisor, Staff 2, Staff 1, and
Youth A are seen shuffling around in what looks like an attempt to
separate Youth A from Staff 1. Supervisor and Staff 2 are able to
get Youth A separated from Staff 1 and attempt to restrain Youth
7

A in a two-person upper torso restraint against the wall as Staff 3
is seen physically holding Staff 1 back from Youth A. Youth A and
Staff 1 continually try to get to one another and are stopped by
staff. Video shows Staff 3 using her body to stop Staff 1 from
getting to Youth A. Staff 1 is seen attempting to get to Youth A
multiple times, once going around a couch to get to Youth A but is
stopped by Staff 3. Staff 3 is seen guiding Staff 1 toward the door
to leave the unit while Staff 1 is continuing to try and get around
Staff 3. Youth D appears to be trying to assist Staff 3 in stopping
Staff 1 from getting to Youth A as well. Video footage does not
show Staff 1 hitting or attempting to hit Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 167840214 for Youth A reads: “[Staff 2] and
Supervisor observe [Staff 1] being irritate and upset and
continuously attempted to try and run up on [Youth A].
[Staff 3] attempted to pull [Staff 1] away from the situation,
but [Staff 1] was observed snatching away several times
and running back up on [Youth A]. It does not appear that
[Staff 1] struck [Youth A] due to [Staff 2] and Supervisor
having [Youth A] in a hook transport and was able to block
any interference.” This information was consistent with
staff and youth interviews.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed Professional Ethics and Standards of
Conduct training within the new hire training on 09/25/2023.
• Record of Written Warning: Director stated in meeting on
November 28, 2023, at approximately 11am, Staff 1 would
be written up for incident with Youth A. On 11/28/2023 at
approximately 2:04pm I was given Staff 1’s Record of
Written Warning. The form was blank except for Staff 1’s
typed name at the top of the document.
• Osceola Youth Center Policy, Standards of Conduct:
Includes the expectation staff are to interact with youth in a
manner promoting their emotional and physical safety.
• Agency Response Plan emailed to Consultant on
11/22/2023: ‘[Staff 1] is not allowed to work on the girls unit,
she has been reassigned to work only with the detention
boys and only with another staff. This will remain in place
pending the outcome of your investigation.”
• Staff 4’s personnel file: There was one verbal warning
dated 10/4/2023 for Staff 4 being disrespectful. Staff 4
completed Professional Ethics and Standards of Conduct
training within the new hire training on 07/24/2023.
8

• DHHS Worker 2 interviewed Youth A face to face at
Corewell Health on 11/21/2023, DHHS Worker 2’s notes
from the interview are: “[Youth A stated that she is at the
hospital due to trying to hurt herself and telling staff that
she wanted to hurt herself. She does not want to go back
to the facility, as the other girls bully her, and she has been
having problems with a staff member. She stated that she
has been having problems with [Staff 1], who is a staff
member. She stated that recently [Youth A] was looking in
[Staff 1’s] direction, and [Staff 1] started "mean mugging"
her and making faces at her. [Staff 1] then asked her "what
are you looking at" and stood up, while looking at [Youth
A]. [Youth A] stated that [Staff 1] then "jumped" at her like
she was going to hit her. [Youth A] stated that she then
grabbed [Staff 1’s] hair and started punching her in the face
with closed fists. While she was pulling her hair and
punching her, [Staff 1] was punching [Youth A] back in the
face with closed fists. [Youth A] stated that "all of the staff"
had to pull her off of [Staff 1], as they were both hitting each
other. She stated that staff pulled them apart, and [Staff 1]
was still trying to "fight and hit her" and staff had to take
[Staff 1] outside, to get her away from [Youth A]. [Youth A]
denied that she was hurt or had any marks and bruises
from the incident. She stated that she was seen by the
nurse, but she is not sure if it was the same day or the next
day. She denied of any pain from the incident. She denied
that this has ever happened before, but [Staff 1] has been
"looking at her and mean mugging her" for a while now and
will make rude comments to her. She stated that [Staff 1]
does not do that to any of the other girls, and [Staff 1]
singles her out. She denied that any of the other staff treat
or act that way to her, and that she is fine at the facility if
[Staff 1] is not around. [Youth A] stated that she has not
seen [Staff 1] since the incident.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as video shows Staff 1
attempting multiple times to get to Youth A and being held back or
blocked by Staff 3. Staff 1 admitted to being angry and in pain
from having her braid ripped out by Youth A and trying to get back
to Youth A. Staff 1 admitted to being stopped by Staff 3 from
reaching Youth A. Staff 1 has a confirmed case from this incident.
Staff 4 admitted to losing his cool, yelling at Youth G, and Staff 3
having to help keep space between him and Youth G. Staff 4
stated staff are not trained to interact with youth in that manner.
9

Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0000770SI dated 10/18/23; CAP approved 11/16/23
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150 Incident Reporting.
Section (4) When a resident’s behavior results in contact with law
Description enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the parent/legal
guardian, responsible referring agency, and the licensing authority
as soon as possible, but not more than 24 hours after the incident.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not notify the licensing authority law enforcement
was at the facility on 11/15/2023.
Investigation Consultant was interviewed via Teams on November 20, 2023.
Consultant reported when reading the incident report involving
Youth A, she read law enforcement was called to assist the
facility. Consultant denied being notified of law enforcement being
at the facility.
Documents Reviewed
• Incident Report 167840214 for Youth A states, ‘[AFA]
informed [Supervisor] to call the police to help control the
situation until [AFA] was able to get back to campus. Law
enforcement was contacted at 6:12pm.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the licensing authority
was not notified of law enforcement being at the facility on
11/15/2023. Consultant read incident report 167840214 involving
Youth A which described law enforcement being called at 6:12pm
to assist the facility.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A and Youth D's incident reports were not completed within
the required timeframe.
Investigation When reviewing documentation of Youth A’s restraint, I noticed
the incident report was submitted two days after the incident
occurred and was still in draft mode as of 12/11/2023. Youth D’s
10

incident report was also submitted two days late. Both restraints
occurred on 11/15/2023 and were submitted on 11/17/2023.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 167840214 for Youth A: Date of incident
11/15/2023, incident reported submitted date 11/17/2023,
as of 12/11/2023 incident report still in draft status.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 167890213 for Youth D: Date of incident
11/15/2023, incident report submitted date 11/17/2023.
Analysis The facility is in noncompliance of the rule for submitting the
incident reports two days after the restraints occurred.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (1) A child caring institution, including private secure juvenile
justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement and
restraint reduction/elimination plan that:
(a) Includes documentation of each restraint.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Each restraint for Youth A was not documented.
Investigation When reviewing documentation and video footage of Youth A’s
restraint from 11/15/2023, Youth A was restrained twice but only
one of the restraints was documented.
Supervisor, Staff 3, and Youth A were interviewed face to face
at the facility on November 28, 2023, separately in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. They all reported Youth A
was restrained twice, one time against the wall and one time in the
hallway by the unit door.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
2 stated she restrained Youth A in a two-person upper torso with
Supervisor and one time in a seated restraint in the hallway by the
door of the unit. Staff 2 stated Youth A was released from the first
restraint right as other youth from the unit ran at Youth A and
started punching and pulling Youth A’s hair. Staff 2 reported she
used her body and so did Supervisor to shield Youth A from the
other youth attacking her. Staff 2 stated she did not count that as
11

a restraint as staff were shielding Youth A while Staff 3 redirected
the youth attacking Youth A off the unit.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of November 15, 2023, was reviewed November
28, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
The first restraint Youth A is involved in shows Staff 1 sitting in a
chair, then stand up as Youth A runs toward her and Youth A
starts punching Staff 1. Supervisor and Staff 2 run to assist as
Youth A is seen grabbing Staff 1’s braids. Supervisor, Staff 2,
Staff 1, and Youth A are seen shuffling around in what looks like
an attempt to separate Youth A from Staff 1. Supervisor and
Staff 2 are able to get Youth A separated from Staff 1 and attempt
to restrain Youth A in a two-person upper torso restraint against
the wall as Staff 3 is seen physically holding Staff 1 back from
Youth A.
The second restraint Supervisor and Staff 2 are viewed walking
with Youth A toward the door of the unit. Youth A is seen pushing
Staff 2 and Supervisor. Staff 2 engages in a restraint, Staff 2, and
Youth A fall to the floor, Youth A kicks her legs up on the wall and
is able to roll her body causing Staff 2 to roll over as well. Staff 2
adjusts the hold from behind and enters a seated restraint.
Supervisor is bent down and appears to be talking to Youth A.
The restraint ends with Staff 2 and Youth A standing up and
walking off the unit. This is Youth A’s second restraint.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as only one restraint for
Youth A was documented. Video footage shows Youth A being
restrained two times. In interviews, Supervisor, Youth A, and Staff
3 reported Youth A was restrained twice.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (3) Notification must be made to the following individuals in the
event of a restraint or seclusion:
(a) If a restraint or seclusion does not involve injury or medical
intervention, or an injury that does not give rise to a serious injury
as defined by section 8 of the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.628, the following individuals shall be notified within 12
hours:
(i) The youth’s parent or parents or legal guardian or
guardians, including the MCI Superintendent, if applicable.
(ii) The youth’s child and family caseworker.
(iii) The youth’s attorney or guardian ad litem.
12

(iv) The youth’s advocate, if applicable.
(v) Any other individual appropriate for notification.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Notification was not made to the required individuals and not
made within the required timeframe.
Investigation When reviewing documentation of Youth A’s restraint that
occurred on 11/15/2023, there were not any notifications made to
the required individuals.
When reviewing documentation of Youth D’s restraint, the
notifications to the required individuals were not made until
11/22/2023. Youth D’s restraint occurred on 11/15/2023.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 167840214 for Youth A: Date of incident
11/15/2023, no notifications for required individuals
documented.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 167890213 for Youth D: Date of incident
11/15/2023, incident notes document required individuals
notified 11/22/2023.
• Incident reporting policy states the program supervisor or
administrator on duty is responsible to make the required
notifications.
Analysis The facility is in noncompliance of the rule for not notifying the
required individuals of Youth A’s restraint and for notifying the
required individuals six days late for Youth D’s restraint.
Conclusion Violation Established
13

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
